title: New Mint Customers Can Get Unlimited Data for Just $15/Month
description: That's a 50% discount; perfect for new customers to try Mint out.
author: Ayomide Sadiq

Mint Mobile is a prepaid carrier in the US that operates on T-Mobile's infrastructure. As an MVNO, you get lower prices than you would with one of the big carriers, and at the same time, as a prepaid carrier, you get lower prices than you would with postpaid. All of that just means that Mint Mobile is a great choice for relatively affordable connectivity. The best part is that, right now, it gets even cheaper. Mint Mobile Will Give You Any of Its Plans, Even Unlimited, for $15 a Month for 3 Months Image: Mint Mobile There's nobody on the face of the earth who doesn't like to save money (unless you're the child of a multi-billionaire). It feels good to get a set amount of value at a lower price than usual. If you're looking for a route to save money when it comes to your mobile phone and its service, then Mint has just what you're looking for. The MVNO is currently running a promotion, giving you the chance to try out any of its plans, whether the 5GB, 15GB, 20GB, or even the Unlimited plan, for a three-month period. The real perk is that, regardless of the plan you choose, it will cost only $15 a month for those three months. That means that the Unlimited plan, which normally costs $30 a month, will be cut in half. That makes for major savings. The price doesn't include any taxes or fees, so that means you'll be paying a few dollars more than $45. Mint Mobile is a prepaid carrier in the US that operates on T-Mobile's infrastructure. As an MVNO, you get lower prices than you would with one of the big carriers, and at the same time, as a prepaid carrier, you get lower prices than you would with postpaid. All of that just means that Mint Mobile is a great choice for relatively affordable connectivity.

The best part is that, right now, it gets even cheaper. Mint Mobile is trying to entice new customers over to its side of the fence, and it wants to do that by offering deals that are hard to say no to. For a three-month period, you can get as much as a 50% discount on its plans, which means unlimited data for as little as $15 a month.

Mint Mobile Will Give You Any of Its Plans, Even Unlimited, for $15 a Month for 3 Months

There's nobody on the face of the earth who doesn't like to save money (unless you're the child of a multi-billionaire). It feels good to get a set amount of value at a lower price than usual. If you're looking for a route to save money when it comes to your mobile phone and its service, then Mint has just what you're looking for.

The MVNO is currently running a promotion, giving you the chance to try out any of its plans, whether the 5GB, 15GB, 20GB, or even the Unlimited plan, for a three-month period. The real perk is that, regardless of the plan you choose, it will cost only $15 a month for those three months. That means that the Unlimited plan, which normally costs $30 a month, will be cut in half. That makes for major savings.

However, before you get too excited, there are some criteria that you need to have in mind beforehand. They're hardly unreasonable, though.

  • This deal is only available to new Mint Mobile customers, so if you have an existing line, you can't participate.
  • The deal requires paying the total sum for the three months upfront, which comes to $45. Even outside this deal, this is how Mint's prepaid plans are paid for.
  • The price doesn't include any taxes or fees, so that means you'll be paying a few dollars more than $45.

You Might as Well Give Mint's Unlimited Plan a Test Run With This Deal

Even if you're not going to stick with Mint Mobile and its Unlimited plan after the deal period elapses, there's no point in not trying it right now. You can switch to your plan of choice once full prices are back.

There are some things worth knowing about the truly Unlimited plan from Mint before you start using it.

It's up to you whether Mint is worth it or not, but the best way to know is to give it a test run. There's no better time to do that than now.
